channel.title: blog.lmorchard.com
channel.description: It's all spinning wheels & self-doubt until the first pot of coffee.

item.title: Using SQLite as a document database for Mastodon exports
item.description: TL;DR: SQLite has JSON functions, generated columns, and full-text search - which all seems like a perfect mix for ingesting exports from Mastodon for search!

item.title: The Machine is Grieving
item.description: TL;DR: Recently, I lost a grandparent and a pet. Such reconfigurations are difficult to process.

item.title: Synology + Docker + VSCode
item.description: TL;DR: My new Synology NAS supports Docker and I can connect to it with VSCode for tinkering with all my horrible projects!

item.title: Begging for Treats
item.description: TL;DR: Ever wonder what would happen if a Kardashev Type II civilization found us cute?

item.title: Animating Mermaid diagrams with terrible hacks
item.description: So, I wanted to produce a GIF animation of a graph diagram changing over time. What I came up with wasn't the slickest result, but it's close enough to what I'd initially imagined.

item.title: There are no ushers on Mastodon
item.description: TL;DR: There are no ushers on Mastodon. There's no one paid to show you to your seat, no one whose job it is to ease you into comfort and remove friction.

item.title: Twitter, or social cowardice as a service
item.description: TL;DR: Yeah, yeah, I'm navel gazing about Twitter over here.

item.title: My summer spent avoiding a writing habit
Taking the Red Shoes
item.description: TL;DR: I'm trying to build a daily creative writing habit. This post is the result of an exercise toward that end. It's probably an awful first draft of a little flash fiction scene, unless I've tried something especially weird or decided to write something meta. Let me know what you think!
